intro: Maba inconstans var. granatensis, commonly known as the granate maba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Nigeria and Cameroon. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in cyathium structures. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. The bark and leaves of this plant have been traditionally used in local medicine for their purported healing properties.
